instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP1V2_S3: What is PP1V2_S3? PP1V2_S3 is a 1.2v power rail present when the machine is in an S3 suspend to RAM state.
definitions.PP0V6_S0_DDRVTT: What is PP0V6_S0_DDRVTT? Power rail for RAM. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B 3 short beep
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B 3 short beep
threads.message: Probably corrosion under RAM chips or CPU. Flux and some heat (150C) to clean it up, do NOT reflow.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B 3 short beep
threads.message:
Why to NOT reflow?

Just curious, it seems you have some trick from experience.
